org.apache.juneau.rest.annotation

Annotation Type HtmlDoc


  • public @interface HtmlDoc
    Contains all the configurable annotations for the HtmlDocSerializer.

    Used with RestResource.htmldoc() and RestMethod.htmldoc() to customize the HTML view of serialized POJOs.

    All annotations specified here have no effect on any serializers other than HtmlDocSerializer and is provided as a shorthand method of for specifying configuration properties.

    For example, the following two methods for defining the HTML document title are considered equivalent:

    @RestResource( properties={ @Property(name=HTMLDOC_title, value="My Resource Page") } ) @RestResource( htmldoc=@HtmlDoc( title="My Resource Page" ) )

    The purpose of these annotation is to populate the HTML document view which by default consists of the following structure:

    <html> <head> <style type='text/css'> CSS styles and links to stylesheets </style> </head> <body> <header> Page title and description </header> <nav> Page links </nav> <aside> Side-bar page links </aside> <article> Contents of serialized object </article> <footer> Footer message </footer> </body> </html>

    • Optional Element Summary

      Sets the HTML aside section contents.

    • Element Detail

      • title

        public abstract String title
        Sets the HTML page title in the header section of the page generated by the default HTML doc template.

        The format of this value is plain text.

        It gets wrapped in a <h3> class='title'> element and then added to the <header> section on the page.

        If not specified, the page title is pulled from one of the following locations:

        1. {servletClass}.{methodName}.pageTitle resource bundle value.
        2. {servletClass}.pageTitle resource bundle value.
        3. @RestResource(title) annotation.
        4. {servletClass}.title resource bundle value.
        5. info/title entry in swagger file.

            This field can contain variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").

            A value of "NONE" can be used to force no value.

            • In most cases, you'll simply want to use the @RestResource(title) annotation to specify the page title. However, this annotation is provided in cases where you want the page title to be different that the one shown in the swagger document.

            The programmatic equivalent to this annotation are the RestConfig.setHtmlTitle(String)/RestResponse.setHtmlTitle(Object) methods.

        Default:
        ""

      • description

        public abstract String description
        Sets the HTML page subtitle in the header section of the page generated by the default HTML doc template.

        The format of this value is plain text.

        It gets wrapped in a <h5> class='description'> element and then added to the <header> section on the page.

        If not specified, the page title is pulled from one of the following locations:

        1. {servletClass}.{methodName}.pageText resource bundle value.
        2. {servletClass}.pageText resource bundle value.
        3. @RestMethod(summary) annotation.
        4. {servletClass}.{methodName}.summary resource bundle value.
        5. summary entry in swagger file for method.
        6. {servletClass}.description resource bundle value.
        7. info/description entry in swagger file.

            This field can contain variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").

            A value of "NONE" can be used to force no value.

            • In most cases, you'll simply want to use the @RestResource(description) or @RestMethod(summary) annotations to specify the page text. However, this annotation is provided in cases where you want the text to be different that the values shown in the swagger document.

            The programmatic equivalent to this annotation are the RestConfig.setHtmlDescription(String)/RestResponse.setHtmlDescription(Object) methods.

        Default:
        ""

      • branding

        public abstract String branding
        Sets the HTML page branding in the header section of the page generated by the default HTML doc template.

        The format of this value is HTML.

        This is arbitrary HTML that can be added to the header section to provide basic custom branding on the page.

        This field can contain variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").

        A value of "NONE" can be used to force no value.

        The programmatic equivalent to this annotation are the RestConfig.setHtmlBranding(String)/RestResponse.setHtmlBranding(Object) methods.

        Default:
        ""

      • header

        public abstract String header
        Sets the HTML header section contents.

        The format of this value is HTML.

        The page header normally contains the title and description, but this value can be used to override the contents to be whatever you want.

        Example:

        @RestResource( htmldoc=@HtmlDoc( header="<p>This is my REST interface</p>" ) )

        When a value is specified, the title() and description() values will be ignored.

        A value of "NONE" can be used to force no header.

        This field can contain variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").

        The programmatic equivalent to this annotation are the RestConfig.setHtmlHeader(String)/RestResponse.setHtmlHeader(Object) methods.

        Default:
        ""

      • links

        public abstract String links
        Sets the links in the HTML nav section.

        The format of this value is a lax-JSON map of key/value pairs where the keys are the link text and the values are relative (to the servlet) or absolute URLs.

        The page links are positioned immediately under the title and text.

        Example:

        @RestResource( htmldoc=@HtmlDoc( links="{up:'request:/..',options:'servlet:/?method=OPTIONS'}" ) )

        This field can contain variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").

        A value of "NONE" can be used to force no value.

        This field can also use URIs of any support type in UriResolver.

        The programmatic equivalent to this annotation are the RestConfig.setHtmlLinks(String)/RestResponse.setHtmlLinks(Object) methods.

        Default:
        ""

      • nav

        public abstract String nav
        Sets the HTML nav section contents.

        The format of this value is HTML.

        The nav section of the page contains the links.

        The format of this value is HTML.

        Example:

        @RestResource( htmldoc=@HtmlDoc( nav="<p>Custom nav content</p>" ) )

        When a value is specified, the links() value will be ignored.

        This field can contain variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").

        A value of "NONE" can be used to force no value.

        The programmatic equivalent to this annotation are the RestConfig.setHtmlNav(String)/RestResponse.setHtmlNav(Object) methods.

        Default:
        ""

      • aside

        public abstract String aside
        Sets the HTML aside section contents.

        The format of this value is HTML.

        The aside section typically floats on the right side of the page.

        Example:

        @RestResource( htmldoc=@HtmlDoc( aside="<p>Custom aside content</p>" ) )

        This field can contain variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").

        A value of "NONE" can be used to force no value.

        The programmatic equivalent to this annotation are the RestConfig.setHtmlAside(String)/RestResponse.setHtmlAside(Object) methods.

        Default:
        ""

      • footer

        public abstract String footer
        Sets the HTML footer section contents.

        The format of this value is HTML.

        The footer section typically floats on the bottom of the page.

        Example:

        @RestResource( htmldoc=@HtmlDoc( footer="<p>Custom footer content</p>" ) )

        This field can contain variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").

        A value of "NONE" can be used to force no value.

        The programmatic equivalent to this annotation are the RestConfig.setHtmlFooter(String)/RestResponse.setHtmlFooter(Object) methods.

        Default:
        ""

      • css

        public abstract String css
        Sets the HTML CSS style section contents.

        The format of this value is CSS.

        Example:

        @RestResource( htmldoc=@HtmlDoc( css=".red{color:red;}\n.blue{color:blue}" ) )

        This field can contain variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}").

        A value of "NONE" can be used to force no value.

        The programmatic equivalent to this annotation are the RestConfig.setHtmlCss(String)/RestResponse.setHtmlCss(Object) methods.

        Default:
        ""

      • cssUrl

        public abstract String cssUrl
        Sets the CSS URL in the HTML CSS style section.

        The format of this value is a URL.

        Specifies the URL to the stylesheet to add as a link in the style tag in the header.

        The format of this value is CSS.

        Example:

        @RestResource( htmldoc=@HtmlDoc( cssUrl="http://someOtherHost/stealTheir.css" ) )

        This field can contain variables (e.g. "$L{my.localized.variable}") and can use URL protocols defined by UriResolver.

        The programmatic equivalent to this annotation are the RestConfig.setHtmlCssUrl(String)/RestResponse.setHtmlCssUrl(Object) methods.

        Default:
        "servlet:/style.css"

      • nowrap

        public abstract boolean nowrap
        Shorthand method for forcing the rendered HTML content to be no-wrap.
        Default:
        false

      • noResultsMessage

        public abstract String noResultsMessage
        Specifies the text to display when serializing an empty array or collection.
        Default:
        "no results"

      • template

        public abstract Class<? extends HtmlDocTemplate> template
        Specifies the template class to use for rendering the HTML page.

        By default, uses HtmlDocTemplateBasic to render the contents, although you can provide your own custom renderer or subclasses from the basic class to have full control over how the page is rendered.

        The programmatic equivalent to this annotation are the RestConfig.setHtmlTemplate(Class)/RestResponse.setHtmlTemplate(Class) methods.

        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.html.HtmlDocTemplate.class
